data.text:
Maritime Training Centers in the Philippines offer a range of services and courses for Filipino seafarers. Comprehensive Training needs to be complied with before someone can work as a Seafarer especially for ship electricians.

1. Azzet Maritime Consultancy Corporation

Azzet Maritime Consultancy Corporation is the Best Maritime Training Center in the Philippines. The main goal of Azzet Maritime Consultancy Corporation is to become the World’s Leading Supplier of Top-Caliber Ship Electricians through excellent training both on site and online based on the International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers, 1978 as amended in 2010 at Manila.

Training’s Offered:

Ship Familiarization for Aspiring Electricians

The training is intended for aspiring SHIP ELECTRICIANS (ETR/ETO)who wants to understand the basic requirements of STCW training, so they can confidently pass the technical electrical interview when applying for outstanding manning agencies to board successfully into international vessels.

This training covers the ship electrical safety, testing instruments, electrical motor controls, preventive maintenance system on engine room machinery, deck equipment and navigational bridge consoles in accordance to STCW Code 2010 Regulation III/6 and III/7.

Ship Familiarization For Deck Cadets

The training is intended for DECK CADETS who wants to know the basic requirements of mandatory STCW training, and confidently pass the technical deck interview in applying to the outstanding manning agencies to board successfully to international vessels.

This training covers the ship familiarization on security, safety working procedures and proper operations on bridge navigation and communications equipment in accordance to STCW Code 2010 Regulation II/4 and II/5.

Ship Familiarization for Engine Cadets

The training is intended to ENGINE CADETS who wants to know the basic requirements of mandatory STCW trainings, and confidently pass the technical engine interview in applying to the outstanding manning agencies to board successfully to international vessels.

Ship Electrician Course

This course provides knowledge, understanding and competency necessary for ship electricians to operate, maintain and repair of ship main propulsion system, power generators, engine room machinery, deck equipment, ship’s crane, marine refrigeration, fire alarms, bridge navigation and communication equipment in accordance to Regulation III/6 and III/7 of the 1978 STCW Convention, as amended in 2010.

Ship Electrician Course comes with free lunch, snacks and unlimited coffee. Take the course for only 5 days (40 hours) of excellent instructions from expert ship electricians.

Marine Online Refrigeration Course

Azzet Maritime Consultancy Corporation through its Founder Engr. Arjay Magpantay made it convenient for seafarers to study Seafarer Maritime Courses online. Apart from the onsite training in their office, seafarers can also opt to take additional courses using smart phones or laptop anywhere in the world.

Not only that, they are the first Maritime Training Center in the Philippines to offer seminars regarding Stock Market Investing Made Easy for Seafarers.

Stock Market Investing Made Easy for Seafarers

This seminar discuss important aspect of why seafarers and their families should invest in the Philippine Stock Market to fund their Retirement Income and enjoyable life with family once they stop working onboard ship.

Stock market is the best investment so far for seafarers who wants to grow their money passively and it can work 24/7 if you want to.

Learn how you start investing in Jollibee, SM, Ayala, San Miguel and biggest Corporations in the Philippines with just starting capital of P5,000 only.

Azzet Consultancy Corporation does not accept walk-ins for their seminars, make sure to reserve before going to their office.

2. Compass Training Center

Competent Maritime Professional and Sea Staff (COMPASS) Training Center, Inc. was established in 2009. The company intended to organize a learning institution dedicated in the development of human resources in the maritime industry through the development and delivery of competence based training and assessment programs. COMPASS Training Centre Inc. is a wholly owned Filipino corporation operating under Philippine Laws. As a training organization COMPASS Training Center Inc. they have courses that are accredited by the Philippine’s Maritime Training Council.

Address:

1913 Luna Orosa Building, Taft Avenue corner Remedios Street, Malate Manila, Philippineshttps://www.facebook.com/compasstrainingph/

3. United Marine Training Center, Inc.

United Marine Training Center (UMTC) is a top-quality maritime educational institution providing world-class instruction and training to seafarers. The company mandate is to develop highly competent marine professionals who are well prepared to face the challenges of the shipping industry. This maritime training center provides upgrading training to all seafarers to augment their skills.

They offer updated cadet training programs that are fully acquainted with the actual demands of the industry, and also developed a customized program to suit a company’s specific needs.The faculty is composed of top-caliber instructors and high-ranking industry practitioners. Facilities, workshops, laboratories, and equipment are state-of-the-art. The company is a product of almost two decades of Marlow Navigation’s pursuit of excellence and innovation in the maritime sector.

Established and named Marlow Navigation Training Center (MNTC) since 1999, they changed their name to United Marine Training Center in 2015 to more accurately represent the spirit of collaboration and commitment the company espouses. In 2004, they expanded their operations to further fulfill the growing need for well-trained seafarers. This led to the setting up of three more classrooms for the cadet training program, a computer laboratory, and a culinary center.The maritime training center finally moved to their present site in the heart of Manila in 2008.

Address: 2120 Leon Guinto Street, MalateManila, Philippines

Call: (02) 981 6682

4. Norwegian Training Center (NTC)

The Norwegian Training Center (NTC) is the preferred maritime and offshore simulator training partner to the global shipping community. NTC was an initiative of the Norwegian Maritime Foundation of the Philippines, Inc. (NMFPI) and established by the Norwegian Shipowners’ Association (NSA) in February 1990. It is the first maritime training center in the world to be certified by Det Norske Veritas.

NTC offers SMART Training that can clearly provide the value for your investment in: Reduced OPEX, Improved Safety Statistics and Increased Company Reputation.

The other facility located in the upward Mall of Asia Complex in Pasay City is the home to the newest, most advanced, and first fully integrated simulation system in the Philippines, also known as Five E-com Campus. It boasts a total of 30 Kongsberg simulators with sophisticated seaview 3D technology, extensive fleet of ship models, and a variety of challenging scenarios that provide the best and most realistic training and learning experience.

This Maritime Training Center is also offering Employment opportunities for Seafarers.

5. Gigamare

GigaMare Inc. was established on the 15th of April 2013 acquiring Wärtsilä Corporation’s training infrastructure in Subic. The company mission is to provide innovative and high quality products and services leading to safe and efficient operations for maritime, offshore, oil & gas, energy, and mining segments.

The company offers environmental and economic training solutions for improved human factor aided by performance gap analysis. This maritime training center in the Philippines has unique hands on academy offers close to real-life experience on operating, repairing, and maintaining equipment and shipboard simulators.

GigaMare has received full course approval for Electro-Technical Rating, Electro-Technical Officer, and Electro-Technical Officer Updating Course.

6. NYK- FIL Maritime Training Center

NYK- Fil is a Maritime Training Center in the Philippines that is engaged in recruitment, selection, as well as deployment of Filipino seafarers for the ocean-going fleet of NYK Liner, it is one of the oldest and largest shipping company in the world. The company has systematically improved and re-defined their compliance standards to meet both local and international regulations.

The company strictly adheres to “No Training No Deployment Policy,” which is realized through their in-house training center, NYK-Fil Maritime E-Training Inc. (NETI).

An ISO 9001:2008 certified company, NETI is engaged in maritime training using state-of-the-art equipment and develops customized training courses designed to meet the specific requirements of Principals. It is accredited by various local and international maritime bodies and directorates as well as the Flag States of Panama and Vanuatu. It is duly recognized by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) for the practical assessment of newly-passed Deck Officers for which it developed scenarios for practical assessment and computerized grading performance using a Full mission Bridge Simulator, a requirement of the PRC.

7. Excellence and Competency Training Center, Inc ( EXACT)

EXACT Center, Inc. is engaged in the development and provision of maritime training courses as well as the conduct of related assessment procedures. A combination of our mandatory, in-house and customized courses creates a range of training programs for navigation, seamanship, engineering, marine pollution, safety, security, communication and offshore courses.

8. Far East Maritime Foundation Inc.

Established in 1992, Far East Maritime Foundation, Inc. (FEMFI) was conceived to provide and deliver quality maritime training’s for Filipino seafarers. Far East Maritime Foundation, Inc. believes in the value formation of a world-class and professional seafarer through high-standard training.

Far East Maritime Foundation, Inc. distinguished itself as among the most trusted maritime training centers in the Philippines by being the first to offer training programs such as; Ship Restricted Radio Operator Course and INMARSAT courses. Far East Maritime Foundation Inc. was also the first maritime training center in the Philippines to branch out in Cebu(1995) and in Pangasinan(1998).

Far East Maritime Foundation Inc. evolved from a one room review center to one of the largest maritime training centers in the Philippines.

9. Newsim- New Simulator Center of the Philippines Inc.

Newsim is a well known Maritime Training Center in the Philippines that offer courses like Basic training, Refresher training for Basic Safety Course, Proficiency in Survival Craft and Rescue Boat. The maritime training course also offers Ship Simulator and Bridge Teamwork with BRM (SSBT) , Electronic Chart Display Information System (w/ AIS) (ECDIS) including Management Level courses for Seafarers, Engine courses that include Marine Engineering, Electrical, Electronic, and Control Engineering as well as other customized seafarer courses.

10. Globe Maritime Training Center

Globe Maritime Training Center is committed to provide a holistic approach to provide globally competitive, highly trained motivated and productive Filipino seafarers. Globe Maritime Training Center was organized last June 2012 after securing its registration from the Department of Trade and Industry as maritime Provider upon completion of all the necessary permits and other documentary requirements for accreditation of Marina STCW Office.

Globe Maritime Training Center started with four(4) maritime courses last October 2012. In December 2012 GMTC was granted accreditation for two (2) additional maritime courses.
